etymologies: Middle English fylberd, from Anglo-Norman French philbert, dialect French noix de filbert (so named because it is ripe about 20 August, the feast day of St Philibert)

definitions: a cultivated hazel tree that bears edible oval nuts.

notes.text: Genus Corylus, family Betulaceae: several species, in particular the giant filbert (Corylus maxima)

shortDefinitions: cultivated hazel tree that bears edible oval nuts

definitions: the nut of the filbert tree.
a brush with bristles forming a flattened oval head, used in oil painting.
shortDefinitions: brush with bristles forming flattened oval head, used in oil painting
